  • Method Details

    • translateSend

      public void translateSend​(Iterable<org.bukkit.command.CommandSender> players, char prefix, String text, org.bukkit.ChatColor... colours)
      Translate a message (according to translate(char, String, ChatColor...)) and send it to a collection of players.
      Parameters:
      players - the players to whom the message should be sent
      prefix - the prefix identifier for colour translation keys
      text - the text to translate
      colours - the colours. Must have at least x amount of colours where x is the amount of unique keys. If less, an UnsupportedOperationException will be thrown.

    • translateSend

    • translate

      public static String translate​(char prefix, String text, org.bukkit.ChatColor... colours)
      Format a String and translate any keyed colour codes prefixed with the given char.

      Every unique character prefixed with the given char will be considered a key assigned to the colour provided by the colours parameter in sequential order. See below for examples: 

         translate('%', "%rThis is red and %athis is aqua, but it's now %r%bred and bold", ChatColor.RED, ChatColor.AQUA, ChatColor.BOLD);
   // Result: "(red)This is red and (aqua)this is aqua, but now it's (bold red)red and bold"
      In the above example, %r, %a, and %b were used as keys. Because %r was the first key, the first ChatColor, RED, is assigned to it. Any recurring instance of this key will be translated to red. a was the second key in the sequence, therefore the second ChatColor, AQUA, was assigned. The same applies to bold which is the 3rd unique key.
      Parameters:
      prefix - the prefix identifier for colour translation keys
      text - the text to translate
      colours - the colours. Must have at least x amount of colours where x is the amount of unique keys. If less, an UnsupportedOperationException will be thrown.
      Returns:
      the translated string

    • translate

      public static String translate​(String text, org.bukkit.ChatColor... colours)
      Format a String and translate any keyed colour codes prefixed by %.

      Every unique character prefixed with a % will be considered a key assigned to the colour provided by the colours parameter in sequential order. See below for examples: 

         translate('%', "%rThis is red and %athis is aqua, but it's now %r%bred and bold", ChatColor.RED, ChatColor.AQUA, ChatColor.BOLD);
   // Result: "(red)This is red and (aqua)this is aqua, but now it's (bold red)red and bold"
      In the above example, %r, %a, and %b were used as keys. Because %r was the first key, the first ChatColor, RED, is assigned to it. Any recurring instance of this key will be translated to red. a was the second key in the sequence, therefore the second ChatColor, AQUA, was assigned. The same applies to bold which is the 3rd unique key.
      Parameters:
      text - the text to translate
      colours - the colours. Must have at least x amount of colours where x is the amount of unique keys. If less, an UnsupportedOperationException will be thrown.
      Returns:
      the translated string
